intro: Leandra depauperata, commonly known as the poorleaf tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of showy, white to pink flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
